reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last minute, I was looking for a place for my wife and I to stay for one night without breaking the bank. I am also very particular about where I stay - cleanliness is my number one factor. And I almost never stay at motels - I prefer the chain hotels, but this is not an option in Montauk. After searching the net and finding numerous Montauk motels, which either had minimum stays, prices over $200 or poor reviews, I decided to give the Harborside a call, given all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Luckily they had 2 rooms available - I chose the 2nd floor which is normally my preference. For $165, it seemed like a good price, so I was wondering if there was a catch. I checked out the photos on the motel's website and it seemed fine though.
reviews.title: Lucky to find the Harborside
What a find - great place
reviews.text: Driving toward the hotel, I was nervous about what it would look like, but upon getting to the Harborside, I breathed a sigh of relief. It seems to have been updated recently (roofs, etc.) and is maintained very well. The 2nd floor room, while decorated in 90's style (white formica furniture and pastel colored bedspreads), was very clean and neat. The beds were OK - not the most comfortable, but better than expected.

reviews.title: Loved the Harborside
reviews.text: The pool and pool area are very well maintained. We happened to watch the maintenance person spend a lot of time carefully cleaning it the next morning.

The motel is conveniently located and easy to find. It's not walking distance to a beach, but reading other reviews it sounds like mangement has passes to give out (we didn't take advantage of this due to lack of time).
reviews.title: Harborside is a good no-frills option
No Problems @ The Harborside Motel
reviews.text: Overall, we didn't spend much time at the Harborside, but for a picky person like me, I would definitely make this my choice again if staying in Montauk. I suggest the 2nd floor rooms as I believe they were updated a lot more recently than the first floor.

spent the weekend in Montauk...Came by boat and stayed at Harborside the second night for more "comfortable" sleeping arrangements. So sorry we didn't stay BOTH nights. The room was huge and the nice white contemporary furniture was GORGEOUS in room 27..Had a little problem with the AC initially but it was corrected almost immediately. Can't wait to go back. Will definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Room & Stay!!
Merle at Harborside is lovely!
reviews.text: I will returning to Harborside once again this July with a friend who has been staying there for years. My first time in Montauk was in July of 2004 and it could not have been more fun. The Harborside offered what all the other "che-che-poo-poo" hotels in town don't. A genuine and unpretentious atmosphere; simple and well kept. It was refreshing to leave all the pretense and vanity that we are all too often surrounded by in our daily lives and just be REAL people . Thanks Merle, your the best! As long as there is a vacant room for me a Harborside, I'll always stay with you.

reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful Harborside and Merle!
reviews.text: I just came back from a WONDERFUL weekend in Montauk. The Harborside and Merle, the owner, were wonderful. Merle gave us GREAT tips about Montauk and the beaches. The hotel was super-clean and freshly decorated. The pool was lovely. It's very conveniently located. I will go back again and again! LOVE IT!

reviews.title: Loved the Harborside and Merle
reviews.text: We went to Montauk this past weekend with my sister-in-law and her family and were horrified by the hotel that we had booked. We passed the Harborside and it looked nice so we pulled in and Merle saved the day by accommodating us with two great rooms at the last minute! The hotel was very clean and pleasantly decorated (the rooms were unusually large). The pool was very clean and warm with a lot of seating. But best of all was the owner, Merle, and her staff. She couldn't be nicer and all of her suggestions for restaurants, delis and beaches were terrific. I suggest that the person who reviewed this hotel poorly call around to the other hotels. They will find few vacancies in mid summer and triple the prices. This was a great hotel in a nice quiet area --walking distance to the docks and minutes away from everything else! Way to go Merle!

reviews.title: Great Place - Wonderful Staff!!
reviews.text: I go to Montauk a lot - This was our first time at the Harborside and it was great!! The room was clean the beds were comfortable and it is close to everything. The pool and the grounds are very nice. I look forward to staying there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheapest place we could find in Montauk. Provided a nice, clean, comfortable room. Nothing fancy, but more than suitable. Fine location.
reviews.title: Cheap, clean, comfortable

reviews.text: I am a globe hopper. Thanks to my job as an entertainer; I have traveled afar. I am now a spoilt tourist, with unique tastes and demands especially on the places I choose for my accommodation, be they hotels, motels or apartments. They must provide me with the comforts of being at home; away from home.

likes.liked: — the excellant attention that was given to me and my friends

reviews.text: Harborside is constantly maintained by a devout staff that dutifully addresses your concerns. The rooms are exceptionally clean and well furnished. The pool and the tennis court are invigorating challenges to any sport enthusiast.
reviews.title: Clean, no frills little place

reviews.title: Pleasant, Friendly Staff in Location Away from the Traffic and Crowds
reviews.text: The Harborside is a charming economical motel with tennis courts and a pool in a location near the boat yards and charter fishing boats. The owner will provide you with a beach pass for the nearby beaches. You are minutes away from lovely public golf and tennis facilities.

The staff is friendly and helpful. The decor is 50's and 60's (fun) but the property is clean and cared for. The staff often leaves coffee and snacks for breakfast. Many rooms have small refrigerators. You are near the walking dunes of Camp Hero and the Lighthouse, within walking distance of Gosman's dock, restaurants and shops. Also nearby is horseback riding on trails near the Lighthouse at the Dune Hollow ranch. This is not a fancy place, but the staff, available delights nearby, and price make it a special place to enjoy and return to.
reviews.title: A good time at the harborisde
Choose Another Place!
reviews.text: I did quite a lot of research into where to stay in Montauk prior to my trip to the USA and found that the hotels in Montauk are very expensive, in fact even moreso than staying in NYC (it was summer!). I booked The Harborside on the basis of the reviews on this site, and on the basis that it was a lot cheaper than most of the other hotels in the area - I wasn't dissapointed - it was just fine.
It's a nice, chilled out place with a nice pool. Fairly quiet and away from it all. If you want a party, don't come here - stay in Montauk town.
reviews.title: wished we'd stayed longer
Harborside Motel and Merle: The best in Montauk
reviews.text: I found the staff to be very friendly, the place was clean, tidy and nice. Fairly basic accomodation, but very nice.
